remarks: Law of excluded middle, also called the principle of _tertium non datur_. Theorem *2.11 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 101.  It says that something is either true or not true; there are no in-between values of truth.  This is an essential distinction of our classical logic and is not a theorem of intuitionistic logic.  In intuitionistic logic, if this statement is true for some ` ph ` , then ` ph ` is decideable.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.)
